verbs.description: unflower (third-person singular simple present unflowers, present participle unflowering, simple past and past participle unflowered)

examples: Look where the winds unflower / The once leaf-flowered tree.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deflower; to take the virginity of.
examples: To prevent the erosion of his own authority, Basil is persuaded to re-enact his father's crime — to unflower the servant girl on her nuptial night.
